channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Discord Will Now Treat Everyone Like a Teen Unless They Prove They’re an Adult
item.description: The platform is expanding age verification globally, meaning adult users will need to verify their age to access sensitive content.

item.title: These ultra-cheap wireless earbuds let you play Flappy Bird on the charging case, and it sure is one of the features of all time
item.description: Flappy Bird on an earbuds case? These ultra-cheap earbuds come with gaming functionality, and while I’m not convinced it adds value, it is fun…

item.title: MrBeast’s company buys Gen Z-focused fintech app Step
item.description: YouTube megastar MrBeast announced on Monday that his company, Beast Industries, is buying Step, a teen-focused banking app.

item.title: ChatGPT’s cheapest options now show you ads
item.description: ChatGPT users may soon start seeing ads in their chats, as OpenAI announced on Monday that it's officially beginning to test ads on its AI platform. They'll appear as labeled "sponsored" links at the bottom of ChatGPT answers, but OpenAI says the ads "do not influence the answers ChatGPT gives you." Currently, ads will only […]

item.title: Bluesky finally adds Drafts
item.description: The move comes as Bluesky’s competitors, X and Threads, have long supported drafts.

item.title: DOJ may face investigation for pressuring Apple, Google to remove apps for tracking ICE agents
item.description: House Judiciary Committee member Jamie Raskin (D-MD) has asked the US Department of Justice to turn over all its communications with both Apple and Google regarding the companies' decisions to remove apps that shared information about sightings of US Immigrations and Customs Enforcement officers. Several apps that allowed people to share information about where they had seen ICE members were removed from both Apple's App Store and Google's Play Store in October. Politico reported that Raskin has contacted Attorney General Pam Bondi on the issue and also questioned the agency's use of force aga...

item.title: FCC accused of withholding DOGE information ‘in bad faith’
item.description: One year and nearly 2,000 pages of documents later, a group suing to uncover what the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) was doing at the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) says the agency has withheld relevant documents "in bad faith" and is asking a court to allow discovery and depositions to draw out the information. "Thus […]

item.title: Who Sent Jeffrey Epstein a Gizmodo Article About Deleting Your Google History?
item.description: Members of Congress are set to get a look at the un-redacted files this week.

item.title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn’t dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
item.description: AI isn't going to replace major SaaS apps with vibe-coded versions, Databricks Ali Ghodsi believes. But it could give rise to competitors.

item.title: Riot is already cutting staff on its new fighting game
item.description: Riot Games is already "reducing the size" of the team working on its recently-released free-to-play fighting game 2XKO, according to a post from executive producer Tom Cannon. The game, set in the League of Legends universe, launched in early access on PC in October and hit consoles just a few weeks ago. 2XKO has been […]

item.title: The Last ‘Person’ You Want Handling Your Surgery Is a Hallucinating Robot
item.description: AI has infiltrated the operating room. It’s going about as well as you’d expect.

item.title: Anthropic’s India expansion collides with a local company that already had the name
item.description: India's Anthropic Software has taken the U.S. AI giant to court over a name dispute.

item.title: Disney Explains Why the ‘Mandalorian and Grogu’ Super Bowl Spot Was Like That
item.description: With the first 'Star Wars' movie in almost seven years just months away from the theaters, some fans were perplexed at Lucasfilm's vibes-based Super Bowl spot.

item.title: This Anker battery pack solved my battery anxiety — and it’s been purchased 3,000 times in the past month
item.description: This Anker portable charger, which is small enough for everyday carry, has become my go-to travel accessory for keeping phones and other devices powered on the move.

item.title: The Verge’s 2026 Valentine’s Day gift guide (for her)
item.description: Valentine's Day often comes with more pressure than it needs to. At heart, though, February 14th is about showing appreciation for the people you care about in ways that feel thoughtful and sincere. And while big displays of romance can do that, it's often the quieter, more personal gestures - or a meaningful gift that […]

item.title: Meta Faces Two Key Trials That Could Change Social Media Forever
item.description: TikTok has already fled the scene.

item.title: Novo Nordisk Sues Hims & Hers Over Ozempic Copycats as the Weight-Loss Drug Wars Escalate
item.description: The lawsuit is the latest in an escalating feud between the Danish pharmaceutical and telehealth company.

item.title: Apple devices are finally getting their first serious discounts of the year — shop my top picks on AirPods, iPads, and smartwatches starting at $99.99
item.description: Apple's pricey, highly sought-after devices are finally on sale, and I'm rounding up today's best deals on AirPods, iPads, MacBooks, and smartwatches.

item.title: Toyota made a game engine
item.description: Using a game engine in a "digital cockpit" can be useful for things like step-by-step 3D tutorials about a car, mapping the environment around your car, and offering more natural controls, Jamie Kerber, the lead engineer of a new game engine developed by Toyota Connected North America, said in a recent presentation at the FOSDEM […]

item.title: ChatGPT rolls out ads
item.description: OpenAI faced a backlash late last year when it tested app suggestions that looked like unwanted ads. Still, the AI company needs to generate revenue from its popular chatbot to cover the costs of developing its technology and growing the business.

item.title: The Bad Bunny Super Bowl backlash fractures conservative media
item.description: Conservative reaction to Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl LX halftime show splintered after President Donald Trump weighed in, prompting some right-leaning commentators to defend the performance. As backlash over Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl LX halftime show rippled through conservative media, a notable group of right-leaning commentators broke with President Donald Trump to defend the performance—in some cases walking back their own earlier criticism....

item.title: Haworth Fern office chair review: Incredibly premium ergonomics with great all day comfortability
item.description: The Haworth Fern is a beautiful ergonomic office chair with a unique design, Wave Suspension technology

item.title: Lidar-maker Ouster buys vision company StereoLabs as sensor consolidation continues
item.description: Ouster is paying $35 million along with 1.8 million shares.

item.title: ExpressVPN two-year plans are up to 81 percent off right now
item.description: If you're looking to up your privacy game on the internet in the new year, you can do so for a little less than usual thanks to ExpressVPN's latest deal. Its two-year plans are up to 81 percent off right now: the Advanced tier is on sale for $88 for two years, plus four additional free months. The Basic plan is where you'll see the biggest discount: it's $68 for two years, plus the same four additional free months. We’ve consistently liked ExpressVPN because it’s fast, easy to use and widely available across a large global server network. In fact, it's our current pick for best premium VPN. On...

item.title: The History Behind the Trial of Seven in ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’
item.description: 'Game of Thrones' has prepared us for trials by combat before, but 'A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms' is showing us a version rooted in ancient Westerosi history.

item.title: Shark Tank star Kevin O’Leary says you’re ‘stupid’ if you work this many hours per day
item.description: The celebrity investor once touted workaholism, but has since changed his tune. Investor and Shark Tank star Kevin O’Leary once declared that to succeed in business you must be willing to grind out 25 hour work days. He has since walked back on that idea, calling it, in his own words, “sheer stupidity.”

item.title: "Wuthering Heights" review: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi front a perplexing and provocative romance
item.description: Emerald Fennell goes more "Bridgerton" than Brontë. Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi co-star in Emerald Fennell's perplexing and provocative adaptation of "Wuthering Heights." Review.

item.title: 'What a great way to kill your community': Discord users are furious about its new age verification checks — and are now hunting for alternatives
item.description: Discord has announced that it's rolling out age verification checks globally from March, and the decision has sparked fury from many privacy-conscious users.

item.title: Trump meme coin down 96% as Bitcoin and meme coins slide
item.description: From Trump and Melania tokens to Dogecoin and Shiba Inu, meme coins are being hit hardest in a volatile crypto downturn. On January 19, 2025, someone paid $75.35 to buy a Trump meme coin. Today, assuming that same investor held the cryptocurrency, the investment has lost 96% of its value.

item.title: Kroger names former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its new CEO
item.description: Foran succeeds Ron Sargent, who has been Kroger’s interim leader since former CEO Rodney McMullen resigned last March. Kroger named former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its chief executive officer on Monday, 11 months after the abrupt resignation of its previous CEO.
